oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de Visite of Lt.-Col. Willimam H. Ingerton, 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ingerton served in the 4th US Cav. Regt. before receiving his commission into the 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA. Ingerton lead the 13th Tenn. into Greeneville, Tennessee on September 4, 1864 where members of the regiment surrounded and killed Confederate General John Hunt Morgan. In November 1864, Lt. J. H. Walker, 2nd Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA murdered Ingerton in Knoxville. It is believed that Walker held a grudge against Ingerton for arresting him for drunkeness earlier in the war.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ingerton, William H.
